TopicTitle: I've set up a community Teamspeak (voice chat) server!

Articles.Content:
I'm one of the mods of the KSP subreddit and due to the fact that I haven't seen any up and I feel that people may enjoy it, I'm happy to announce a community Teamspeak server for Kerbal Space Program!

FAQ

  • What is Teamspeak? - Teamspeak is a program which lets people voice and text chat to each other! It's available for free on pretty much everything, Windows, Mac, Linux, Android, iOS!
  • Where can I get it? - From their downloads page. Make sure to pick the client version!
  • What's the KSP community server IP? - ts.kerb.al:9989 or 198.46.132.178:9989 - Thanks to reddit user Zacknut for the kerb.al address!
  • How do I join? - When you've got Teamspeak open, click the 'Connections' button, then 'Connect'. For the server address, look at the above question, nickname is what you'll be called. Then click 'Connect', and you are in! You can also make Teamspeak auto-connect to the server by adding the server to the 'Bookmarks' and checking 'Connect on startup'.
  • I've completed a subreddit challenge and I want the flair on Teamspeak! How do I get it? - Send me a pm, send us a reddit modmail or poke one of the people with Alpaca usernames on the Teamspeak server, and we'll sort it out!

Currently the server has 128 slots and is hosted in Buffalo, New York. If you have any suggestions for the server, please reply below!

Edited April 20, 2013 by Flambe

This sounds great, if only so that I can bother people about my rocket in real time.

See you there!
